author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: Will sharding incentivise centralisation p2p layer? i.e. all validators and all nodes connect with a "leader peer" who has good DOS protection, good latency etc. And eventually disconnect all other connections. This saves everyone's data serving costs by a lot.

author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: It might happen even before sharding due to MEV and spam ... but esp curious about once sharding happens

author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: so far ethereum is assuming cost of serving data to other nodes is zero, there's no compensation for it. will this assumption break when there's terabytes of data to serve?
